relation: Tab to the first link in the first frame that says "Give Keyboard focus to the applet" and press enter.
Type search term and press enter
Control is transferred to the applet
Focus is transferred to the content section
Focus is transferred to the list of contents
Scroll through the list of contents--focus moves to item in list
Expand or contract list of subtopics
Control is transferred to right hand frame, which contains information about subtopic
Scroll through subtopic content in right hand frame
Control is returned to the content section in left hand frame
Control is transferred to search tab
Search is made and results displayed
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {20752=If you are still having difficulty using this application after you have tried the below techniques, please call the DWC Statewide Disability Accommodation Coordinator at 1-866-681-1459 (toll free) or through the California Relay Service, by dialing 711 or 1-800-735-2929 (TTY) or 1-800-855-3000 (TTY-Spanish). Or email us at DWCADA@dir.ca.gov for assistance., 30004=June 2010}
textBeforeTable: The table below describes how to navigate through the Curam help application. Press the insert key plus F9 to switch between the left hand and right hand frames Press the insert key plus F1 for keyboard navigation instructions. Curam help consists of two frames: the first containing navigation, the second containing content. Keyboard navigation for Curam help Fonts can be increased in Internet Explorer as follows: View > Text Size > Larger or Largest. The browser screen can be enlarged by pressing control plus the plus sign. Color settings for text, background, visited and unvisited links can be set in Internet Explorer as follows: Tools > Internet Options > Colors. Contrast settings can be set in Windows XP as follows: Control Panel > Accessibility Options > Adjust the contrast for text and colors on your screen. EAMS will inherit the windows accessibility settings on your computer. Changing contrast and enlarging pages A skip to main content link is provided at the top of each page in Curam. Dropdown menus can be accessed using the alt plus arrow keys. An upgrade for JAWS 7.0 is available from Freedom Scientific to enable you to access dropdown menus (http://www.freedomscientific.com/fs_products/software_jaws710fea.asp#download). Pages timeout after 30 minutes. An alert window will popup to ask if you want to continue. Mandatory input fields are marked by an asterisk. Many are also identifed by the label "mandatory." Input is not saved until forms are submitted. General accessibility information
textAfterTable: eForms information General If a document contains instructions or legal disclosures, directions are given in the first form field for how to access them, typically using headings or page-based navigation. Drop down menus can be accessed by turning Forms mode on (in JAWS), then pressing alt plus the up or down arrow. Tab Forms (heading level one) will take you to page navigation. Cover Sheet (heading level two) will take you to page content. eForms have three frames: banner, form and form content The Banner frame contains buttons to save forms or add attachments. The Form frame contains links to individual pages of the form. The FormContent frame contains form content. Navigate through frames by pressing insert plus F9. Select the frame you want from the frames list. Forms generally contain two sections: cover sheets and form pages Cover sheets contain information about a particular case. Form pages contain information about a claim or determination. Navigate to pages by going to the Form frame then tabbing to the page you want. Press insert plus F9 to bring up a list of frames and choose the FrameContent frame. Press H to navigate page using headings, press tab to navigate from field to field, or press insert plus the down arrow to read all. If form field labels are not read, reset the page by pressing insert plus F9, select the FormContent frame and press enter.
